module.name: LConvEncoding
module.short: Used to perform conversions between Unicode and System Code Page encodings.

descr.p: lconvencoding.pas provides types, variable, constants, and routines used to perform conversions to and from Unicode and /or System Code Page encodings. Functions in this unit are thread-safe.
For environments where the RTL uses UTF-8 encoding, the UseSystemCPConv compiler define is enabled to include System Code Page conversions.

element.name: TConvertEncodingErrorMode
element.short: Represents the behaviors for an error occurring in an encoding conversion.

descr.p: TConvertEncodingErrorMode is an enumerated type with values that represent the behavior applied when an encoding conversion error is detected. TConvertEncodingErrorMode is the type used for the ConvertEncodingErrorMode variable.

element.name: TConvertEncodingErrorMode.ceemSkip
element.short: Skip or ignore the encoding conversion error.

element.name: TConvertEncodingErrorMode.ceemException
element.short: Raises an EConvertError exception with a message relevant to the conversion error.

element.name: TConvertEncodingErrorMode.ceemReplace
element.short: Replace the suspect value with an error placeholder (usually the '?' character).

element.name: TConvertEncodingErrorMode.ceemReturnEmpty
element.short: Return an empty string ('') for the suspect value.

element.name: ConvertEncodingErrorMode
element.short: Error handling behavior for encoding conversion errors.

descr.p: ConvertEncodingErrorMode is a unit global TConvertEncodingErrorMode variable which controls the behaviour of encoding conversion errors for the following:
The default value for the variable is ceemSkip, and indicates that an error is skipped or ignored when encountered in an encoding conversion.

element.name: UTF8BOM
element.short: ANSI representation for the UTF-8 Byte Order Mark.

element.name: UTF16BEBOM
element.short: ANSI representation for the UTF-16 Big Endian Byte Order Mark.

element.name: UTF16LEBOM
element.short: ANSI representation for the UTF-16 Little Endian Byte Order Mark.

element.name: UTF32BEBOM
element.short: ANSI representation for the UTF-32 Big Endian Byte Order Mark.

element.name: UTF32LEBOM
element.short: ANSI representation for the UTF-32 Little Endian Byte Order Mark.

element.name: GuessEncoding
element.short: Tries to determine the encoding used for the specified value.

descr.p: GuessEncoding is a String function which tries to determine the encoding used for the value specified in S. The return value contains an encoding name, like 'utf8' or 'ISO-8859-1'. It may contain an empty string ('') when S is also an empty string.
GuessEncoding checks S for various Byte Order Marks at the start of the value, including: UTF8BOM, UTF16LEBOM, and UTF16BEBOM. When present, the BOM determines the encoding used for the value.
Next, it checks for an explict '{%encoding ' marker at the start of the value. When present, the value after the marker (up to the closing '}' character) is normalized and used as the return value.
Finally, it checks for a valid UTF-8 encoding (which includes ASII characters). All characters in S are examined until a character whose UTF-8 code point is not valid is encountered.

When EncodingValid is True, EncodingAnsi is assumed. Otherwise, the default encoding for the platform is used. When the return value is EncodingUTF8, it is changed to 'ISO-8859-1'. This is done because the system may use the UTF-8 encoding, but the value in S does not. ISO 8859-1 has a full mapping to Unicode, and this prevents data loss in encoding conversions.

element.name: GuessEncoding.Result
element.short: Encoding name detected, or a default value.

element.name: GuessEncoding.s
element.short: String with the content examined in the routine.

element.name: ConvertEncodingFromUTF8
element.short: Converts the encoded value from UTF-8 to the specified encoding.

descr.p: Used in the implementation of the ConvertEncoding function.

element.name: ConvertEncodingToUTF8
element.short: Converts the specified value to the UTF-8 encoding.

descr.p: Used in the implementation of the ConvertEncoding function.

element.name: ConvertEncoding
element.short: Converts the encoding for a value from its source encoding to the target encoding.

descr.p: This routine gets the default encoding name used for text from the DefaultTextEncoding unit variable. It contains the encoding use for AnsiString in the RTL.

element.name: GetDefaultTextEncoding.Result
element.short: Returns the value in the EncodingAnsi constant ('ansi').

element.name: GetConsoleTextEncoding
element.short: Gets the encoding used in a console on the platform.

descr.p:
This routine returns the console text encoding, which might be different from the normal system encoding on some Windows systems. See
http://mantis.freepascal.org/view.php?id=20552

element.name: NormalizeEncoding
element.short: Converts the specified encoding name to lowercase and removes '-' characters.

element.name: TConvertEncodingFunction
element.short: Specifies a function used to convert the encoding for a string value.

descr.p: TConvertEncodingFunction is the type used for the ConvertAnsiToUTF8 variable.

element.name: TConvertEncodingFunction.Result
element.short: Value after converting the value to the required encoding.

element.name: TConvertEncodingFunction.s
element.short: Value examined and converted in the routine.

element.name: TConvertEncodingFunction.SetTargetCodePage
element.short: Indicates whether the code page is needed for the target encoding. Default is False.

element.name: TCharToUTF8Table
element.short: Alias for the TCharToUTF8Table type in CodepagesCommon.

element.name: ConvertAnsiToUTF8
element.short: Routine used to convert from ANSI to UTF-8 encoding.

descr.p: ConvertAnsiToUTF8 is a TConvertEncodingFunction variable provides a routine used to convert a String value from its ANSI-encoded value to the UTF-8 encoding.

element.name: ConvertUTF8ToAnsi
element.short: Routine used to convert from UTF-8 to ANSI encoding.

element.name: UTF8BOMToUTF8
element.short: Removes the UTF-8 BOM from the UTF-8 encoded value.

descr.p: The return value is the value in s after removing the Byte Order Mark in UTF8BOM from the start of the string. The return value is the same as the value in s when UTF8BOM is not found in the string.
No actions are performed in the routine when s is an empty string (''). The return value is also an empty string.

element.name: UTF8BOMToUTF8.Result
element.short: Value after removing the UTF-8 BOM.

element.name: UTF8BOMToUTF8.s
element.short: UTF-8-encoded value examined in the routine.

element.name: ISO_8859_1ToUTF8
element.short: Converts an ISO 8859-1-encoded value to UTF-8.

element.name: ISO_8859_2ToUTF8
element.short: Converts an ISO 8859-2-encoded value to UTF-8.

element.name: CP1250ToUTF8
element.short: Converts a Code Page 1250-encoded value to UTF-8.

element.short: Deprecated in Lazarus 2.2.0. Use KOI8RToUTF8 instead.

descr.p: Deprecated in Lazarus 2.2.0. Use KOI8RToUTF8 instead.

element.name: MacintoshToUTF8
element.short: Converts a value encoded using the the Macintosh Code Page to UTF-8.

element.name: SingleByteToUTF8
element.short: Converts a string with single-byte values to UTF-8 using a character mapping table.

element.name: SingleByteToUTF8.Result
element.short: String with the UTF-8-encoded value, or an empty string.

element.name: SingleByteToUTF8.s
element.short: String with the single-byte values converted in the routine.

element.name: SingleByteToUTF8.Table
element.short: Table with Character to PChar mappings for the converted value.

element.name: GetSupportedEncodings
element.short: Fills the specified string list with supported encoding names for the platform.

descr.p: GetSupportedEncodings is a procedure used to get the names for the supported encodings on the platform or operating system. GetSupportedEncodings adds each of the encoding names to List; it does NOT removing any existing content in the string list.
GetSupportedEncodings stores the following values in List:
For platforms that support Asian code pages, the following encoding names are added to the list:
The following encoding names are added to the end of the list:

element.name: GetSupportedEncodings.List
element.short: String list where supported encoding names are added.
